sentences.en: Definitions in this dictionary are printed in roman type.
sentences.cn: 这本词典里的释义是用罗马体印刷的。

sentences.en: Early Christians smashed the gods of many Roman temples.
sentences.cn: 早期的基督教徒们捣毁了许多罗马寺院的神像.

sentences.en: Ex-cavations have revealed Roman and Anglo-Saxon remains in the area.
sentences.cn: 挖掘工作已显示在该地区有罗马和盎格鲁-撒克逊时代的遗迹。

sentences.en: He had been ordained as a deacon in the Roman Catholic Church.
sentences.cn: 他被任命为天主教的助祭。

sentences.en: He was wearing a Roman kilt and laurel wreath.
sentences.cn: 他身穿罗马人的褶叠短裙,头戴桂冠.

sentences.en: Like her, Maria was a Roman Catholic.
sentences.cn: 和她一样，玛丽亚也是天主教徒。

sentences.en: Roman vessels used to sail with the tide from Boulogne to Richborough.
sentences.cn: 罗马的船只过去经常乘着潮汐从布洛涅航行到里奇伯勒。

sentences.en: She, too, was a convert to Roman Catholicism.
the apotheosis of a Roman Emperor
the grandeur and simplicity of Roman architecture
sentences.cn: 古罗马建筑的雄伟和简朴

sentences.en: The Pope is the supreme leader of the Roman Catholic Church.
sentences.cn: 教皇是罗马天主教的最高领袖.

sentences.en: The three statues above are probably Roman divinities.
sentences.cn: 上面的3尊雕像可能是罗马诸神。

sentences.en: There are many stories about the nymphs in Roman fairy tales.
sentences.cn: 罗马神话中有许多关于仙女的故事.

sentences.en: There are Roman remains all around us.
sentences.cn: 我们周围都是古罗马的遗迹。

sentences.en: They have found several fragments of a Roman vase in the area.
sentences.cn: 在这一地区他们发现了一只罗马瓷瓶的碎片.

sentences.en: When they conquered Britain, the Romans brought this custom with them.
sentences.cn: 当古罗马人征服不列颠时，他们把这一习俗也带了过去。

phrases.tran_cn: 罗马天主教的；天主教会的；天主教徒
罗马天主教会；罗马公教
罗马帝国（指公元前27年到公元476年的罗马奴隶制国家）

trans.tran_cn: 古罗马的，罗马人的，罗马基督教会的，天主教的
trans.tran_en: relating to ancient Rome or the Roman Empire

trans.tran_cn: 古罗马共和国或帝国的人，罗马市民，天主教教徒
trans.tran_en: A Roman was a citizen of ancient Rome or its empire
